org.jpws.pwslib.crypto
Class HashMac

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.crypto.HashMac
Direct Known Subclasses:
SHA256, SHA512
public abstract class HashMac
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class implements the MD4-like block/padding structure as it is used by most hashes (MD4, MD5, SHA-0, SHA-1, RIPEMD-128, RIPEMD-160, Tiger). This class handles the message buffering, bit counting and padding. Subclasses need implement only the three abstract functions to create a working hash. This class has three padding modes: MD5-like, SHA-like and Tiger-like. This applies to the padding and encoding of the 64-bit length counter.

Since:
2-0-0
Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
Jeroen C. van Gelderen (gelderen@cryptix.org)
Modified by Wolfgang Keller, 2004

Constructor Detail

HashMac

protected HashMac(int hashSize,
                  int mode)
Construct a 64-byte HashMac in MD-like, SHA-like or Tiger-like padding mode. The subclass must call this constructor, giving the length of it's hash in bytes.

Parameters:
hashSize - Length of the hash in bytes
mode - padding mode (MODE_MD, MODE_SHA, MODE_TIGER)

HashMac

protected HashMac(int blockSize,
                  int hashSize,
                  int mode)
Construct HashMac with 64 or 128-byte blocksize in MD-like, SHA-like or Tiger-like padding mode.

Parameters:
blockSize - 64 or 128
hashSize - Length of the hash in bytes.
mode - padding mode (MODE_MD, MODE_SHA, MODE_TIGER)

public void update(char[] input)

update

public void update(char[] input,
                   int offset,
                   int length)
Update sees an array of chars as a sequence of bytes as they are stored, which means each char as 2 bytes in Big-Endian order (most significant stored first).

Parameters:
input - a char array
offset - start offset in input
length - number of chars to be used for this update

update

public void update(java.lang.String input)
Update sees a String as a sequence of chars as if they were an array of chars derived with input.toCharArray().

Parameters:
input - a String

update

public void update(java.lang.String input,
                   int offset,
                   int length)
Update sees a String segment as a sequence of chars as if they were an array of chars derived with input.substring(offset,offset+length).toCharArray().

Parameters:
input - a String
offset - start offset in input
length - number of chars to be used for this update

reset

public void reset()

coreDigest

protected abstract void coreDigest(byte[] buf,
                                   int off)
Return the hash bytes in buf, starting at offset off. The subclass is expected to write exactly hashSize bytes in the given buffer. The buffer is guaranteed to be large enough.

coreReset

protected abstract void coreReset()
Reset the hash internal structures to initial state.

coreUpdate

protected abstract void coreUpdate(byte[] buf,
                                   int off)
Update the internal state with a single block. buf contains a single block (64 bytes, 512 bits) of data, starting at offset off.
